Given an alphabet size $k$ and a target substring length $w$, find the number of strings of any length that can be formed using this alphabet, such that the longest substring within the string that is also a weak subsequence of the string has length $w$. 

A string $a$ of length $n$ is considered a weak subsequence of a string $b$ of length $m$ if:

1. There exists a set of indices $1 \le i_1 < i_2 < ... < i_n \le m$ such that $a_k = b_{i_k}$ for all $k$ from 1 to $n$.
2. There exists at least one $k$ ( $1 \le k < n$) such that $i_{k+1} - i_k > 1$.

Output the number of such strings modulo $10^9 + 7$. If there are infinitely many such strings, output "-1".

You are given a set of letters and a target length.  Find the number of possible strings you can make using these letters where the longest subsequence within the string is of the target length.  If there are infinitely many possibilities, output -1.
